definition: main force/main strength of an army
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: And all those absent in Nangang are important players.
sentences.chinese: 而且南鋼缺席的又都是主力隊員。

sentences.english: They leapfrogged the enemy's main force and struck at his weak points.
sentences.chinese: 他們避開敵人主力而打擊其薄弱點。

sentences.english: However, I was still too careless with my units and lost my main troop too easily.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，我還是輕易的損失了的主力部隊。

sentences.english: I counted four battleships definitely sunk, three severely damaged.
sentences.chinese: 我數了一數，有四艘主力艦無疑已經沉沒，三艘重創。

sentences.english: Jose Mourinho rested five of his regular starters.
sentences.chinese: 摩連奴讓五名主力休息。

sentences.english: Our mission is to harass the landing of the main japanese expeditionary force .
sentences.chinese: 我們的任務是騷亂日本遠征軍主力的登陸。

sentences.english: The auxiliary units are called in only when the main force has been overtaxed .
sentences.chinese: 只有在主力軍承受過重壓力時纔會召來預備部隊。

sentences.english: He led the main strength of his army against the city.
That means SEVEN capital ships in a single fleet.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着一支艦隊可包含七艘主力艦。

sentences.english: But mainly must depend upon young compatriots who presents to take the main army.
sentences.chinese: 但主要還得依靠在座的年青宗長作爲主力軍。

sentences.english: Large numbers of the enemy's main force were at last pinned down.
sentences.chinese: 敵人的許多主力部隊終於被牽制住了。

sentences.english: It took three weeks for Grant's men to reach the steamboat landing. The roads were very rough.
sentences.chinese: 格蘭特主力經過三個星期纔到達汽船登陸點。

sentences.english: Unit B1 packing is the main model in cigarette factory of china.
sentences.chinese: B1包裝機組是我國很多捲菸廠的主力機型。

sentences.english: Young cadre is national future, it is the brunt of our country reforming and opening.
sentences.chinese: 青年幹部是國家的未來，是我國改革開放的主力。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the 28th Regiment, which was the main force, had not suffered great losses and on August 18 it occupied Kueitung.
sentences.chinese: 幸主力第二十八團損失不大，於八月十八日佔領桂東。

sentences.english: By autumn your main force will probably be fighting to cross the Yangtse.
sentences.chinese: 秋季你們主力大約可以舉行渡江作戰。

definition: to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
main assault/to focus on/to specialize in/to major in
the front line/the attack (e.g. football forwards)
troops appearing suddenly (in a raid or ambush)
